Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for an Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: shayes915
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our Vancouver leg of our Seattle-Vancouver trip. After staying in a wonderful hotel in Seattle, we were quite disappointed in this hotel, which was more expensive. While we loved the location and the customer service, the room left a lot to be desired. There was not enough counter space in the bathroom for my toiletries, so I had to keep them in the kitchen and walk back and forth. I'm quite surprised there have not been more complaints about the bed as I can't recall a worse sleeping situation at any hotel I've ever stayed at. At the very least, a hotel of this caliber should have comfortable mattresses and linens. Our balcony did not have a table and chairs. I couldn't get the heat to warm the room. The TV's are outdated and cheap. Valet service was great, but at $40 per day it should be. There is a fee for internet service and the wireless was USELESS in our room. We had breakfast at Fleuri -$18 for what most hotels call a "Continental Breakfast" (fruit, cereal, oatmeal, and pastries) seemed a little overpriced to me. Not sure why everyone loves this hotel...Definitely won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: bungadoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my two young children for my daughters 8th birthday. I was expecting the hotel to be nice, but from my experience with other "fancy" hotels, was not expecting the exceptional sevice we did receive here. Everyone was so friendly and welcoming from the doormen to the front desk staff to every employee we happened to come across in the hall, the elevator, wherever. All asked us how we were, how we were enjoying ourselves. Even if the room hadnt had been as fantastic as it was, the customer service puts this hotel right up at the top 5 best places Ive ever stayed. The icing on the cake, however, was when we received an unexpected knock at the door and the hotel had sent up chocolate covered strawberries and a happy birthday message for my little girl, compliments of the vice president! That really made her feel like a princess, and its the extra things like this that make a hotel fabulous. The location is great, the room was huge, clean, modern and as I said, the service was outstanding. This will now be my number one choice to stay whenever Im going to treat myself and family in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Will book there again”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. The decor is a bit dated but in good condition. Best draw is the central location in downtown. For the value-price ratio, highly recommended. Dining Sanafir on Granville Street was amazing. Wonderful food, service and ambience. Marcello's on Commercial Drive, being 1/2 Italian myself, it's some of the best Italian I've ever had from a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: llipgh58
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver last October for the Pens-Canucks game. My friend found this hotel at the last minute on hotels.com. I wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. Huge one bedroom suite, with a full kitchen. While the furnishings were a little older, the room was spotlessly clean. The hotel is centrally located in town, and close to many shops, restaurants and attractions. My only complaint, which is keeping me from giving this hotel an excellent rating, is the charge of $20 (CND) a day for wireless service in the room. Most hotels charge no fee/minimal fee for this service.

Reviews.Title: “Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: familytravellerz
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this full-service hotel several times and, because we have two small children, we stay in the two bedroom suites in La Grande Residence. For this location, the suites at this hotel are very spacious (two bedrooms and two bathrooms, plus a kitchen). The bathrooms could use some updating, but aren't terrible. Location: The location of this hotel is tops. You have immediate pedestrian access to all that Robson Street has to offer. They also provide guests with a shoppers card that provides discounts at various stores on Robson. Dining: Room service food (from Fleuri) is very good. We've mostly ordered breakfast and found the portions huge (you could almost share a meal). The Gerard Lounge is also very good (although not suitable for children). There's even a Japa Dog just beyond the front entrance. Parking: Ouch! It's very pricey. Spa: Good Service: I saved the best for last. It is Exceptional. Every staff member we encounter on each of our stays provides outstanding service. We are big on service, and it's what keeps us returning to this hotel. If you plan to stay more than once, I'd recommend enrolling in the Prestige Program. It has earned us spa treatments and once, a complimentary night's accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: GandTNinja
Reviews.Content: I would struggle to find anything negative to say about this hotel. We stayed for three nights in a suite which was very clean, spacious, comfortable and had everything we needed. The location is very good to get to the various places of interest. The staff were friendly and helpful. We felt this provided very good city centre accommodation at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Stayed again at La Grande Residence, fourth time in total at Sutton Place. Still love it. The staff is so accommodating and courteous. Miguel and Jennifer at the Concierge took very good care of us. This time we stayed with our two small kids and were very happy to have all the facilities in the kitchen for the baby. Used the swimming pool as well, which was nice since we stayed for seven nights and it rained a lot. Housekeeping service was daily and very accommodating. They provided us with a high chair for the baby as well as a crib. Whenever we needed something they brought immediately. We used the self service laundry, which was great as well as dry cleaning which was extremely fast and still affordable. We are big fans of the Sutton and definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Keyboardlemon
Reviews.Content: The room set up was good, big room, clean, comfortable, good gym and pool. Not impressed with: - Internet was an extra $15 per day! - No complimentary breakfast - local calls were charged to room Would prefer to stay at Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all & great location”
Reviews.Author: jbaby1977
Reviews.Content: The service was great from all staff - didn't matter we were in the 'residence' part & not the 'hotel'. Room 356 is a corner room on Burrard & Smithe; not what we asked for but we only heard sirens during the day...there is hospital 3 blocks away. The room is fairly standard, nothing fancy about it. could use a new paint job, but overall for the $$ it was fine. The pool was nice, but chilly! it also is 1.2 to 1.3 meters...no shallow end for little kids; but they did have a few pool noodles etc that our 3.5 year old took advantage of. I can not comment on room service or restaurants as we never ate there. THe "Marketplace IGA" is across the road & perfect to grab breakfast items & snacks to have on hand. I highly recommend the "Pacifico Pizzaria" at 970 Smithe St - not even a block SE of the hotel. Great food & kid friendly too! Best thin crust pizza around! Our concierge recommended "Joey's on Burrard" as being a family friendly place...but it was too pricey for us with a 3 year old & the only thing our daughter would eat was sliders off the appy menu as there is no kids menu. The curtains are very heavy & keep out a lot of light - excellent when you have kids! Overall we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When I want to treat myself right...I come to the Sutton”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in dozens of hotels in Vancouver, but when I want to treat myself right, I stay at the Sutton. The service is perfect, with friendliness and efficiency, the rooms are always clean, the location CANNOT be beat. Right downtown, a block away from robson. The concierge is always helpful, and always willing to get you any tickets if possible. The swimming pool is of decent quality, and the weight room is actually pretty fantastic (DB weights that actually go up to 90-100 which is odd for a hotel). Worst part of it? It's not a "good" deal if money is your worry. The restaurant is really expensive, and is only so so in taste to be honest. I had the concierge get me hockey tickets a few times, and they always come at scalper prices (x2-x3 the price depending on if they were playoffs or regular season). But if you know what you are getting into, and have the money to burn, they treat you like you want to be treated. Thinking of that, gotta book my Christmas trip now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mwatkin
Reviews.Content: Booked blind through Hotwire 3 nights at start of road trip (whistler, Jasper, Banff, Emerald Lake, Vancouver island) excellent location on edge of Robson street, within easy reach of all usual visiter sites. Excellent Suite, no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aa87
Reviews.Content: The location is great-very close to Robson and Yaletown, Stanley Park and the waterfront are also walking distance (15-20 minutes). The quilt was heavy and lumpy and we didn't get the best sleep. The room we stayed in seemed a bit outdated (old tv set, bathroom etc). I prefer the Sutton Place Residence to the actual hotel ( we stayed there last year. And the service last year was exceptionally good- it was late at night and we asked whether there was a store close by we could buy snacks from and the manager sent us some crisps and chocolates for free!) The concierge was very helpful; one of the ladies at the front desk not so much! Internet is not free which was a bit of a pain and a bit odd considering you can get free internet at many cafes and other hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: JudyWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three days in Vancouver before and after a Celebrity cruise to Alaska. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and the room was very nice. We did not use the facilities very much because we spent most of our time out and about Vancouver, but the staff was great in pointing us in the right direction as to what to see and how to get there. In addition, it is in a great location; in walking distance to many things and easy public transportation. I would strongly recommend staying at The Sutton Place Hotel and will stay there again should we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy60974
Reviews.Content: We had a room at the Sutton Place Hotel for 2 nights. It was clean,nicely decorated and roomy with nice view of downtown. Concierge was very helpful and even helped us print boarding passes. Great location. Marketplace and great restaurants and stores nearby.. Can get hop on ,hop off trolley out front. This was a wonderful way to see Vancouver. Loved Stanley Park and all the shopping areas. Lobby was beautiful.Has free coffee and maker in cupboard. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Boetie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a lovely apartment with all the services of the hotel. The rooms were spacious and clean. The service were ecellent. Friendly staff who are helping you with a smile. I was very sad to leave

Reviews.Title: “Nothing "Grande" about the Sutton Place Grande Residence”
Reviews.Author: cjay0121
Reviews.Content: Upon entering our suite at the "Grande Residence" I was immediately appalled at how dated and worn it was. I was hosting a girlfriend and her children from Los Angeles and was completely embarrassed! The suite felt like a run down apartment in the West End. The bathroom looked like something you would find in a hospital and the dishes in the kitchen were circa 1971!! The atmosphere consists of dirty run down couches/dining chairs and paint chipped walls. The only way to update this place would be a complete overhaul. There was not one drop of "Sutton Place" quality. Quite frankly, I am amazed that there is any association at all. This place is completely mis-represented with the Sutton Place name. After the first night I phoned down and asked to speak to the manager. I expressed my concerns and asked to be moved to the hotel side to which I was told would be fine however would cost me an extra $100/night on top of the $339/night I was already spending!! When my girlfriend explained that her children woke up in the 20 year old pull out with bug bites on their legs I was told that housekeeping would "take a look" and never heard anything further. (The kids slept with their mother after that!) My husband and I stay in beautiful suites at the Westin Kaanapali Villas in Maui every year for less than what we paid in this hole. It was a complete disgrace and an insult to anyone who books under the guise of it being associated with the Sutton Place name.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: Ceci123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful! Nice decor, staff is very attentive. The location is great, right in the middle of where all the shops are, a few blocks away from the cruise terminal. My only 'but': If you are on vacation, you can't go wrong with this hotel. However if internet connection is a must for you, and you need it in your room, youre out of luck, because you have to pay extra for this. And it is expensive too. Specially for this hotel's price range. The Delta hotel is a few blocks down, their lobby is not as fancy looking as the Suttons, but the connection there is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but pretty darn good”
Reviews.Author: RadWife73
Reviews.Content: The La Grande Residence at Sutton Place is an "extended stay" type set up. In my experience that means shabby smoke-saturated rooms, little service, and overall unpleasantness. Thankfully that doesn't apply at the La Grande Residence. I really wish I could give the place 5 stars but the condition of the rooms and noise level merit a 4. Service: 5 stars; Location: 5 stars; Amenities: 5 stars; Room condition: 3.5 (could use new carpet and a little updating but overall, very comfortable and not too bad); Noise: 2.5 (yes, I know, it is downtown, but the noise level was a bit excessive). I would definitely recommend this place for families, people who like extra room, people needing an extended stay, and even people requiring shorter stays if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice- few things could make it better”
Reviews.Author: upperdeckplease
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 10 nights in August 2011 over two stays, before and after a cruise. Rooms huge with an unusable balcony (incredibly noisy air conditioner) but lovely kitchen, very comfortable bed, great TV in Lounge. Pluses Bed very comfortable Kitchen very handy Lounge comfortable and welcoming Staff friendly Location good Very clean Very handy laundrette on Mezzanine floor Less good Breakfast hot buffet only usually warm, never hot Room variable depending on floor and location on floor Rooms a bit dark We only really had two problems while we were there. Our 'guaranteed early arrival' room for which we paid 40CAD plus 12% tax was no such thing, but charge removed and offered a free late deaprture room on final day instead. Room wasn't cleaned one day, even though we went out at 9.30am and put the 'please service our room' tag on the door. We returned at 4pm to find the tag still there but the cleaner cleaned round us

Reviews.Title: “Not quite like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: Texasstarr
Reviews.Content: The staff was VERY nice, as Canadians are. The rooms are not as luxurious as the pictures show. The view was looking into apartments across the street and the hotel is right around the corner from a fire station. All day and night long, we would hear the loud sirens. Very annoying. Not a bad place to stay and it is right in the middle of downtown, but Coal Harbor has wonderful views and you can rent a very luxurious two bedroom condo for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...Location, Location, Location....”
Reviews.Author: everestpete
Reviews.Content: Visited The Grande with my wife and 2 daughter on our summer holiday. Location was perfect for visiting Vancouver and area. Walked around from hotel everyday and visited many points of interest such as Gas Town, China town and found that we couldn't have chosen a better place to set down our bags for the 3 nights we spent in Vancouver. Walked to restaurants 2 nights and went to pick up Sushi for the other night just a block from the hotel. 1 Bedroom flat was perfect. View on the town amazing. High class accommodations. Uses kitchen for a few meals as well... When we left we all got a nice little bag of cookies and a bottle of water for the road. I would not hesitate to go back, we all loved it....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations, lots of space and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: UFAlum88
Reviews.Content: This is what every hotel should be like. The location in Vancouver is central for sightseeing, the rooms are huge, the beds are amazingly comfortable, the staff is very accomodating, and the hotel itself is maintained impeccably. I live near the Breakers in Palm Beach...this hotel is much better.

Reviews.Title: “La grande folie avec Melanie”
Reviews.Author: BelleOrchidee
Reviews.Content: Sutton Place is located downtown therefore very practical for shopping, visiting Stanley Park, Granville Island, exploring China Town and walking about. Easy to find pubs, street vendors with excellent food and hotel personnel is very professional and knowlagable about Vancouver. Extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Do you like being nickel-and-dimed?”
Reviews.Author: OdeLA41
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because it offered a suite for a reasonable price on Hotwire, which was helpful on this family trip with a small child. However, the stay ended up being a lot more expensive than expected because this hotel overcharges you for everything. Parking ended up being nearly $50 per night, which is absurd for the area, and Internet, which these days must be as standard as soap in a respectable hotel, was also expensive. It must also be stated that the amenities are not what you would expect from a luxury property. They might have been "luxury" a few decades ago, but now the rooms, although large, are dated and feel unclean. Worse yet, when we asked for a late checkout, the lady at the front desk was not only unhelpful but rude. She informed us that the hotel was full and therefore late checkout was not available UNLESS we paid their day rate. Pointing out the internal contradiction of this proposal did not sway this "customer service" oriented individual. She simply said that it is what it is and it was the best she could. When told that we pass and will just avoid the hotel in the future, she rudely responded: "Well, thank you very much." No attempt was made to actually offer anything that would resemble customer service. I will not stay here again, no matter how discounted the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place Hotel never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: michaeljames101
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite on the residential side of the Sutton Place Hotel in Vancouver from June 30, to July 3, to celebrate Canada Day. We've been staying at the Sutton Place Hotel for many years and it is easy to say that this property never disappoints. Over the past couple of years, we have selected the residential tower known as La Grande Residence because of the convenience that comes with staying in a one-bedroom apartment that includes a full kitchen with dishes and utensils. If more room is needed, they also have two-bedroom apartments as well. And if that is not enough convenience, there is an urban chic IGA market right next door for all of your grocery needs. So La Grande Residence is a great choice whether you're staying for a couple of nights or a couple of weeks. In essence, your suite becomes a home-away-from-home complete with a wide-screen TV and a 5.1 surround-sound home theatre system. We've even bumped into a few celebrities over the years who stay in these suites while filming a movie in Vancouver. I do have one minor criticism, however, and it is that the beds are a wee bit too firm. The Sutton Place is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver. World-famous Robson Street with its endless shopping opportunities, restaurants, and coffee shops, is only steps away. In fact, there is a world of shopping and dining opportunities all within walking distance from the hotel. If that is not enough, the Scotiabank theatre, one of the nicest movie theatres in Vancouver, is right across the street. There are two places to dine within the hotel. Gerard Lounge is a great place to meet for a drink and a casual bite to eat. Gerard's martinis are fantastic and I would highly recommend them. The expresso martini complete with floating coffee beans is exceptional! The Fleuri Restaurant offers more formal dining , yet still remains west coast casual. We have come to enjoy their afternoon tea complete with scones, finger foods, and pastries. It's a great way to spend some quiet time together in relaxed, friendly surroundings. And on Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays, the Fleuri sets up their extravagant chocolate buffet during evening dining. Something you have to see to believe! The hotel has a wine store on site called The Wine Merchant. Their selection of wines is fantastic and you do not have to break the bank to buy a bottle from this store. Our purchase made us eligible for The Wine Merchant club card which can be used for discounts of up to 50% on food purchases in both eating establishments of the hotel. This is a great value, especially if you intend to visit the hotel again. All in all, this is a great place to stay in Vancouver. Oh, and don't forget to pick up a gourmet hot-dog on your way out the door as one of the best known vendors in the city, Jappadog, sets up nearby on the street corner of Burrard and Smithe. Just look for the line-ups, you can't miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Has everything except free Wifi”
Reviews.Author: JKH09
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything but does not supply free wifi as we have come to expect when travelling. The suite was a very good size & well equipped. The hotel is in a good central location.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: nugmeister
Reviews.Content: central luxury! We had an apartment with full kitchen, home cinema system, monster tv and big comfortable bed. What more could you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but definitely not a five star rating based on Hotwire"”
Reviews.Author: Larry1688
Reviews.Content: Just like what the other reviewers were saying, this is definitely not a five star hotel after all since the room furniture, decorations and TV require some kind of makeover. However, the location is definitely a plus to me since it is conveniently located right next to Robston Street which houses a lot of fine restaurants and shops. In addition, the hotel does possess a very friendly and courteous hotel staff. From the doorman to the concierge, everyone was very highly dedicated to his or her respective dutiy which impressed me a lot. Last but not least, there is an IGA Supermarket located right next to the hotel. For those with infants or toddlers, if you need to buy groceries such as milk, fruits, diapers or even baby formulas, I would seriously consider staying at this hotel since all you you have to do is cross the side street from the hotel to get to there. One word of advice for those who is arriving in a car, I would recommend parking elsewhere since the hotel parking is very expensive compared to the other lots in the area. In short, if you do not care about how the hotel rooms looks as long as the hotel is centrally located, I would recommend this hotel to anyone since Hotwire offered such a good rate for this hotel. However, if you do care about how the room looks and feels, I would recommend staying at the some other hotels such as Fairmont Pacific Rim, Hotel Shangri-La or St Regis which are a lot more pricier, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, awesome place to stay and we will be back”
Reviews.Author: smithsjr
Reviews.Content: 12 June 2011. What a lovely hotel to spend our last night in Canada. We had travel from Kelowna and were pretty tired. Check was a breeze, very friendly and helpful reception staff. The guys that help us with our luggage were great. Our favorite were the Concierge staff they really went over and beyond the call of duty they were so very help, kind, curious, friendly and most of all they made a huge impact on our stay. Our room was huge for a standard one bedroom, it really was huge, wonderfully presented, and it was comfortable, the bed was a huge king size, with crispy clean sheets and fluffy pillows. The balcony was so lovely to stand out on and have coffee even though the weather was rather unpleasant. We had dinner and breakfast in the dinning room and it was fantastic as was the service. The pool, gym, spa and laundry were all fantastic, we went home with clean clothes without having to look for a laundry mat or take home. We stay on the 8th Floor. It was ok. All in all it was a lovely place to stay at. One disappointment and that was the internet was not included in our room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: TampaAbuela
Reviews.Content: Everything you need for an extended stay is within a couple of blocks. Market, movies, great restaurants and shopping all close and the room was so comfortable with a balcony to just sit and relax in the mornings and late evening. David was the perfect concierge listening to our needs and helping us navigate at our comfort level for our interests and price range. As always, TripAdvisor helped us make a great decision on a hotel. Food in the bar was amazing - not your typical bar food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, And you feel at home with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: africanblend
Reviews.Content: Walking to everything, Taxi service at your door almost 24hrs, Pleasant personal. Value / Price is average.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel stay should be . . .”
Reviews.Author: cadubbs
Reviews.Content: My second stay at The Sutton Place in Vancouver (April 21-24, 2011)was just as charming as the first. The hotel is well located in downtown Vancouver. Anything and everything to do is within easy walking distance (try a Japadog from the stand out out in front of the hotel). Spectacular shopping is just around the corner. From the start, it was easy to see that my stay would be a pleasing one. The doorman, valet and bellman were attentive and very helpful. Check-in was an absolute breeze. Regrettably, a suit and a couple of dress shirts of mine did not travel well, and a quick phone call to the Valet brought quick attention. All items were expertly pressed and returned to me within a few hours. On Saturday, I sent a pair of shoes down for a quick polish and had them back within the hour. Thursday night (our first night), my father-in-law and I had a delightful dinner at Fleuri, the hotel restaurant. The waitstaff was excellent, and the food expertly prepared, not to mention delicious. The menu is intriguing and invites you to open your mind and palette to unique preparations. The service and menu are on par with some of the best restaurants at which I've dined, if not better. I followed with a couple of drinks at Gerard Lounge, where I found the bar staff to be an agreeable lot, eagerly helping the Canuck fans assuage their grief over an embarrassing showing against Chicago. We stayed in a two bedroom residence. The room was well appointed and had ample closet space. A small kitchenette was in the room, though we did not avail ourselves of it much. All of the necessary accoutrements are available for use. The beds are such that it's a toss-up between getting out of bed straightaway and seeing the city or tarrying awhile (which I did on Saturday morning) before starting your day. These racks are ideal for breakfast in bed. I cannot imagine wanting to stay anywhere else when i visit Vancouver. The hotel staff from housekeeping to management is first rate. It is readily apparent that they enjoy their jobs and take customer service seriously. I've stayed at upscale hotels comparable to The Sutton Place and been left wondering why I spent the extra money over a Holiday Inn; never so with The Sutton Place. My thanks and compliments to an extraordinary hotel! It is worth mentioning that The Sutton Place is an upscale hotel and as such is priced accordingly, but it was all money very well spent.

Reviews.Title: “The most unbelievable level of service”
Reviews.Author: Auscaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Sutton Place Hotel (Grande Residences) for 5 nights between Xmas and New Year 2010. Everything about the place was outstanding - the location, the accommodation, the bar and restaurant and most of all the staff. We had a 1 bedroom deluxe apartment, and all-in-all it surpassed our expectations. We headed off to Whistler for 8 days and, as we were returning to Vancouver on the morning of the 8th of January, but only flying back to Australia at midnight that night, we decided to book a day room at Sutton Place, with the arrangement to vacate at 6pm. At 5.45pm, one of the people in our travelling party became ill enough that we needed to extend this time. After briefly explaining the situation to the front desk, we were told that we could have the room for as long as was necessary. The care and concern shown by the staff was unbelievable. They facilitated the calling of a doctor and offered assistance in getting to the hospital, phoning the room to see if a wheelchair was needed, an ambulance or taxi was required and generally if anything could be done. As people who are lucky enough to be reasonably frequent travellers and who have come to expect a certain standard of accommodation and service, we cannot recommend this place highly enough. We have stayed in a variety of hotels in Vancouver but would not stay anywhere else in future. If any staff of this hotel get to read these reviews, they may remember the events of that night. I say thank you from the bottom of the hearts of all of us who were there. As a point of interest, the other couple (with 2 young children) in our travelling party stayed in a one bedroom king suite, which was enormous and beautifully appointed. Their two young daughters slept on the foldout couch in the lounge and I believe they were very comfortable. We also had a family staying in a 2 bedroom apartment during the 5 days that we were there and who who were equally impressed. I would be delighted to answer any specific questions in regard to nearby restaurants etc that we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Classy as always, La Grande Residence is nice.”
Reviews.Author: apollo_e
Reviews.Content: I can see why people rave about the Sutton Place hotel: location is amazing (just steps from world-class shopping), service impeccable, food great. This review is for the longer-stay part of the hotel, La Grande Residence, however and while we ultimately give it four stars, it is really a 3.5 in our eyes. All of the aforementioned really go a long way to making you almost overlook some of the shortcomings of the apartments...almost. The suite we had was spacious, nicely decorated, but the paint was peeling in the bathroom and baseboards, the cupboards in both the bathroom and kitchen were terribly dated, and the carpet was showing its age. The Sutton Place is also located close to a police station or fire station because we heard sirens late at night for the entire week of our stay. It blended into the background after the first night though but it was still somewhat annoying. But still, despite these flaws, you just can't help but love the place. From the moment you step through the doors, they treat you like important people. The service was beyond reproach, from the doorman to the concierge to the room service staff. Excellent people and worth a return visit all by itself. But add to that the great food from the restaurant and room service, the well-equipped gym and very nice swimming pool area, to the awesome location, La Grande Residence is a nice place for an extended visit in Vancouver. In summary: good room size (one bedroom queen suite, 7th floor), great service, great amenities, great food, awesome location; drawbacks: peeling paint, worn carpet, dated cupboards. 3.5 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not a 5 star property”
Reviews.Author: CdnTravellerCalgary
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from spending our Christmas holiday at the hotel. While there were many great things about the hotel, there are few places that could use improvement. The good: 1. Great location. Very convenient. Can walk to many places. 2. Fleuri Restaurant in the lobby had good food at fairly reasonable prices. 3. The lobby looked great. Lovely Christmas decorations/trees. Marble was nice. Very well-kept. 4. Suites were large. The living area, kitchen, dining area and separate bedroom were appreciated. 5. Flat screen TVs were good. 6. We had free internet with our room. While this should be included nowadays, we liked having free access. 7. Pool was decent. 8. Staff was very helpful and polite. Promptly delivered extra blankets, etc. 9. Gym was clean, well maintained and had a great selection of equipment. One of the best hotel gyms that I have ever seen. The bad: 1. Not a great view from our room. 2. Noisy in the evenings from traffic below. Hard to sleep. 3. Bathroom was very small. 4. Room decor was dated and a bit dark. It could definitely use some refurbishing. 5. Hot tub was a bit mucky. It could use a good cleaning. 6. At $40 per night, parking was too expensive. Overall, I feel that the hotel lobby, etc. was a 4.5 star, while the rooms themselves were a 3.5. That being said, I would stay here again. The good outweighs the bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beth1215
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying 3 nights in this Downtown Vancouver hotel. It is close to public transportation so you could get anywhere in the city. The concierge was very knowledgeable in helping us first timers get around. The room was an apartment with a comfortable bed, a kitchen, and a big screen tv in the living room. Great views from the balcony where we had coffee in the morning enjoying the city sounds. Can't wait to go back to beautiful Vancouver and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlineGonzales
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel....from location to service..no complaints. This hotel is located in the heart of downtown near restaurants and wonderful shopping. The Hop-On Trolley is right across the street. I cannot say enough about the staff...clearly helpful in every way and remember my name each and every time I saw them. Restaurant food is way above average...chocolate buffet....what can I say? I would definitely recommend and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pern453
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the La Grande Residence side of the hotel for two nights. We had a nice galley kitchen, fold out couch, and balcony. The hotel is beautiful. Even our 11 year old daughter noticed new flower arrangements each day. We aren't fancy people, but the touches were noticed. We had a great rate as we signed up for the frequent stay benefits. If you want free wi-fi sign up for it. It's free! We also were supposed to get $30/day in food and beverage credit. It wasn't very clearly explained, so we missed out on one day as we arrived later in the evening. Guess we should've gone to the bar! We did see Lou Diamond Phillips, but didn't say anything to him. I guess when you see people you're not really sure you can believe you eyes or something. Later my husband and I talked about it and both of us had noticed.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star quality but good enough.”
Reviews.Author: bluelace
Reviews.Content: We stayed last week at the Sutton. The place is well located and the concierge staff very attentive. We enjoyed our stay but I think the hotel is a bit dated. The rooms were renovated few years ago and is time to do it again. The room was dusty and on the small side. The lobby isn't comfortable too small for a downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “over rated”
Reviews.Author: mika0805
Reviews.Content: pros: great location nice valet service nice housekeeping service good promo rates including valet service cons: dated decor - dark 1 bedroom unkept - clock missing battery, balcony latch missing, window handles were broken a/c is very loud

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: KateH2010
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip to Vancouver and I joined him with our three month old baby. The location is hard to beat as it is so central to everything. We took the Skytrain from the airport to the city and it was then an easy walk to the hotel. There is an IGA market over the road with a good selection of food that is easy to prepare in a hotel kitchen. The suite kitchen didn't have any dishes suitable for heating in the oven. Recognizing not everyone wants to cook it would be helpful to have a few available upon request for guests who do want to take advantage of the kitchen. The hotel provided a proper crib for the baby which we really appreciated. The rooms were well serviced and cleaned. The hotel employees were all very courteous and helpful. We will be back to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Gumby1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sutton in June 2010. I found the best rate was on the hotel website, with many different promotions going on all the time, almost too many choices. The triple AAA rate seemed to be the best each time I checked but as the date came closer, the promotional rate turned out to be the best. I was looking for the one bedroom suite so I ended up booking in the grand residence tower. Wow, it was huge! It was a full one bedroom apartment with balcony, huge bedroom with king size bed (which was so comfortable!!!) galley kitchen with 4 full size appliances as well as blender, toaster, kettle and all the utensils/dishes/etc you need for entertaining! I was really impressed! There was a pullout couch in the living room as well as a huge flatscreen t.v with dvd and surround sound speakers! The patio had a bistro table and chairs which I used alot! I had a great view too from the 18th floor! There is an IGA market directly across the street for all of your grocery needs. There's a wine store attached to the hotel! I never ate in the restaurants but the room service was excellent everytime and served in style! Check in and check out was very quick and smooth. There was really only a couple of things that I was disappointed in: 1) when I booked on line, I was under the impression that my wireless internet ($15.00/day) would be included if I became a prestige member and booked on-line, it would also come with a $25.00 dining credit daily.(all of the promo rates come with this credit) I actually printed out the confirmation stating that it would be included. When I checked in they told me that with the promo rate that I received, wireless was not included but the $25.00 credit was. I tried to explain that it had nothing to do with the promo rate, that I received it for signing up as a member, but they would not budge. 2) Parking as everyone knows in Vancouver is very expensive, but when you are staying in a 5 star hotel, I expect the parking to be included! Sure if you want valet, that's different, but I thought $35.00/day was a little ridiculous. I would even consider $15.00 per day. They should just skip the dining credit and include parking and internet! There was also one day from about 4-7pm that there was no hot water. When I called, they blamed it on the city and told me I could go over to the "hotel" side and shower, well that's like walking across the street to another hotel, not very convenient at all. After a long discussion, and me cancelling my dinner reservations, I was able to get them to credit some of my charges for the inconvenience which was acceptable. Over all, I would give this hotel 5 out of 5 rating and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Loved it! PS, I forgot to mention that they have an indoor pool and hot tub and an outdoor patio (very private with fence and trees) with super comfy deck chairs, so perfect for catching some rays and relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “You Can't Go Wrong at LGR in the Sutton Place Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SageGuy
Reviews.Content: This is a top end hotel that offers tremendous value for the money. In La Grande Residence you get a full size suite with a separate bedroom, full cooking facilities, and dishwasher for your convenience. The rooms are scrupulously clean and the staff are beyond reproach. The room rates are frequently better than what a person would pay for a standard hotel room. The location is tremendous within easy walking distance of the waterfront, Granville Island, and Robson Street. Compare prices and you will be pleasantly surprised. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Space”
Reviews.Author: SBH01
Reviews.Content: I booked through expedia with promotion of 50% off food and parking. Great deal with great location and plenty space. Excellent customer service. Only downside is no wifi and you have to pay for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Sutton Place is a Hotwire Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: Irishman_27
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1-bedroom suite at the Sutton Place on the a Sunday night in May. We parked the car ($35) with the valet, as expected from these reviews. We were struck by the friendliness of the staff... in particular it was mothers day and every staff member seemed to be wishing my wife a happy one. We were upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite which was outstanding. There was a king-sized bed in the main bedroom with an ensuite bathroom. The other bedroom had a queen bed and there was also a pull out sofa bed in the living room which we didn't use. Full kitchette including toaster, microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, etc. Location was outstanding... Japadog right out front, IGA right next store so we didn't have to pay crazy hotel restaurant prices. Starbucks is just across the street and of course the shopping & restaurants on Robson are well documented. My son and I made use of the hotel pool and locker room. Nice cushy beach chairs on the pool deck and good light. Only problem was having to descend a staircase from the locker room down to the pool itself. Overall an excellent experience. Not sure if the condition of the room is quite a 5 star but our experience was 5 stars. Only small complaints were (a) the room did not have a locking bolt outside th reach of my 3 year old child and (b) the room temperature seemed a little warm and outside of our control.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: Bukwaas
Reviews.Content: Went on business in Sep 2009 ($200 per night via Hotwire) with my wife & toddler: Hospitality – Professionally and efficiently done via the adjoining Sutton Place. Really plush lobby. Free newspaper. Expensive self parking ($30/day), but with in/out privileges. Food – Easier to eat at a nearby Vancouver restaurant than at the hotel. Accomodation – A bit tight on space, but more than enough in our 1 bedroom suite. Fantastic large sized TV with amazing sound system. Great kitchen cutlery, dishwashing supplies, cooking utensils and small appliances. Fantastic location, couldn’t be better in downtown Vancouver, really. We ran outside for workouts, walked short distances for nearby shopping (you get a 20% discount at Roots for staying at the hotel!), and drove for major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for service and location!”
Reviews.Author: xanderhwl
Reviews.Content: The apartments in this hotel are brilliant and have all the facilities needed for an extended stay or a fleeting visit. The Hotel has good fitness facilities and a swimming pool which is never busy! The drawback is having to walk down a flight of stairs once you have gotten changed for swimming - wear flip-flops! My partner and I dinned in the restaurant for breakfast, which was very reasonably priced - Don't think that the portions will be small like most hotels! We ordered double the first morning, expecting small quantities of food, but were pleasantly surprised! The staff were brilliant and courteous at all times. I would recommend this hotel for all types of travellers from single/couples to families. It is located in the heart of Downtown Vancouver with a grocery store next door which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient, large appartments”
Reviews.Author: Reisefuedli
Reviews.Content: Was my third time staying at the Sutton Place, but first time in an apartment. We requested an apartment, since we travelled with our little girl, and it was convenient to have a kitchen to prepare her food in the morning. Sutton Place staff is always very friendy and accommodating. We loved it. Apparently the Sutton is the only hotel in Vancouver with five diamond accolades. They deserve it. Love the Gerard Bar in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: scifigirl
Reviews.Content: My bf and I stayed here for a week and a half for a romantic getaway. We got a really cheap travel package and got a great deal on a one bedroom suite here, as we really wanted to have a kitchen. We were so surprised when we checked-in: we had been upgraded to a two bedroom, 1.5 bath. The living room felt spacious and we enjoyed the big screen TV and DVD player, the kitchen was bigger than my apartment's kitchen at home and had a minimal but handy collection of pots, pans, and utencils. Not enough to make a 4-course meal, but definitely came in handy for breakfasts and lunches. I'm pretty neat, and, unlike the below poster, I did not find anything to be filthy. Far from it. The bed and furniture were very comfortable and the bathrooms were fine. No one put towels in our bedroom - the little half bath was perfect for me to do my makeup in. The staff was very friendy. The wi-fi was weak, so I just used my ethernet cord. I hate paying for internet though. By now, it should just be a given. Parking was also rather expensive. My biggest complaint was some credit card issues, as the hotel could not use my debit card as a credit card for incidentals until it came time to pay up at checkout. Caused a very minor inconvencience. The location was so convenient, right in the heart of downtown, plenty of late night grocery stores and restaurants and an easy walk to Robson street. Plus, as it's part of The Sutton Hotel... Japadog stand is right in front. That's enough to give the hotel four stars on it's own. Could've eaten there every day. (We nearly did.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: friscocat
Reviews.Content: I recognized this hotel on Hotwire (5* condo) and decided to book it at the great rate of $90 USD for a weekend stay. It is a part of the Sutton Place Hotel and uses the same check-in and amenities as the rest of the Sutton Place. There is no separate sign for La Grande, although you do have the option to use the side entrance to go directly to La Grande when going to your room. Our one bedroom suite was spacious compared to a regular hotel room, and we had a separate living room and bedroom as well as a full kitchen. The living room included a large flat screen TV, DVD player, and surround sound. Service was very good, and we had no complaints. We had full maid service, including turn-down service. We also had access to all of the facilities of the Sutton Place, including a large fitness center and nice indoor pool. Celebrities tend to stay at La Grande when filming movies in Vancouver, and we saw a few in the elevators. The location is great and within walking distance of many of the attractions in Vancouver. We had breakfast at a place right around the corner on Robson Street called Cafe Crepe. It was good and inexpensive. There are many restaurants and shops along Robson Street, which is very close to the hotel. We also did the Vancouver Trolley tour, which has a courtesy stop at the hotel. On the negative side, the decor is modern, but the building is an older one. Also, the hotel charges for high speed internet access. Overall, we had a good stay and enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MattSF76
Reviews.Content: I was a little surprised to see so few reviews written for this property (only two), but after looking around for a place to stay with my family for Christmas weekend, we decided to risk it and are glad we did. The La Grande Residence is a old Condo building next to the Sutton Place Hotel which they have purchased and use for longer term stays. The location is great, right off of Robson Street which is smack in the middle of downtown. The nice thing is that you get use of the pool and all of the other amenities of the hotel and yet get to have more space than your average hotel room. We had a two bedroom unit with one and a half baths (the half being off the master King bed suite). There is a full, but small kitchen, complete with pot/pan, dishes, oven, full sized fridge and dishwasher. This was great for cooking meals at "home" rather than needing to eat out every meal. There is also a grocery store just across the street. The rooms are not huge but don't feel small by any hotel standards. It is also nice to have a living room with large flat screen TV, sofa bed, and a dinning table for four. There is a small balcony which we didn't use since it was snowing. The unit, since it use to be a condo also has more than enough closet space. The furniture and decor were nice. Not five star by any means, but nothing seemed over worn and we felt like we could relax in the room for the night without feeling trapped in a hotel room. The service seemed great. We had a quick check in and the doormen always were very polite with smiles on their faces. The central location made it an easy walk to anywhere in downtown. It was about a 30 minute walk to Stanley Park and even shorter down to the area were the new Olympic Park is starting to be built. Anyone traveling with more that two people or looking for more than just your standard hotel room, I would recommend you check out this place. It is nice to have the extra space, especially if it is in the winter months when it is cold and gets dark early.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was terrible”
Reviews.Author: Cindy12388
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our two toddlers in a two bedroom unit. I rely faithfully on Tripadvisor but unfortunately there was nothing written when I booked. Our unit was absolutely filthy (the kitchen sink sponge had dirt and food and hair crusted into it; the cabinets had food and dirt stuck to them, the carpets and upholstery were visibly dirty and so greasy and disgusting to touch we could not walk without shoes or sit without putting a sheet over the furniture), the switch plates and some baseboards were broken, the walls in dire need of paint or at least a good hosing down. The bathroom was so small that housekeeping puts the towels in the bedroom as there is neither enough rack or counter space to keep them in the bathroom, the furniture was mismatched and really tacky, the air conditioner and open electrical panel is in the walk in closet (really just a utility closet with two wire racks to hang clothes) and it is so loud that we couldn't stand to have it on while we were in the room, nevermind on the balcony where the exterior portion of the unit sits . We unfortunately had to put our kids down for a nap immediately and could not request another room right away. As soon as possible I went to the front desk and described the room to the clerk; I told her that I assumed this room was an aberration that simply had not been updated when the rest of the hotel was built or renovated. She assured me that all the rooms were identical except that if I wanted I could pay to upgrade to a 2 bedroom penthouse unit. A really nice bellman took me up, and I have to say that it wasn't much better. The appliances were stainless steel and overall the unit had less dirt but I would never describe it as clean. I told him I'd talk it over with my husband, and while doing so I received a call from the front desk manager who said she'd been told about my concerns and we accepted her offer to upgrade us to the penthouse unit free of charge. I have to say this was extremely good service as I'd never even asked to speak with management. At 1:00 a.m. there was a huge crowd of people yelling and smoking in the hallway for so long we finally called the front desk, and we were told that we were not the first people to call and complain and they would have security attend. A while later security showed up and asked them to quiet down a bit, but the crowd noise and smoke continued in the hall until we phoned a second and third time. In all, we lost about 2 hours sleep and our children were half scared out of their minds. The hotel dealt with this very, very poorly.

HotelInfo.Name: La Grande Residence at the Sutton Place Hotel Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 845 Burrard St | at the Sutton Place Hotel, Vancouver, British Columbia V6Z 2K6, Canada
